subject: Class Not Found Error from a Command Line
msgSnippet: This is a common question, but just the same I can t see the trouble. On Windows with junit 4.1, I create a .bat file like so: set JARS=. bin set
messageBody:
This is a common question, but just the same I can't see the trouble.

On Windows with junit 4.1, I create a .bat file like so:

set JARS=.\bin
set JARS=%JARS%;..\somedir\lib\junit.jar

java -cp %JARS% org.junit.runner.JUnitCore com.something.test.SomeTest

I run this .bat file one directory up from bin. The test class file is here, relative to the current directory:

bin\com\something\test\SomeTest.class

junit tells me "Can not find class: com.something.test.SomeTest"

The format of the test is old (extends TestCase), but I don't think it finding the class at all. Interestingly, if I just run this:

java -cp %JARS% com.something.test.SomeTest

It says can't find main, which would seem to indicate that it is finding the class file.

What could be wrong? I have used "dir" commands in the .bat file to make sure everything is where I think it is.

Thanks
